result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicole Marie Pilrain

records.addlTxt: filed by Tina S. from JSC stating DE did not report to JSC when requested.  Includes 21CF521, 22CF443, 22CF455, and 22CF705.  Per SRN on 11/1/22- JA to contact Atty Olson - DE to report by Thursday (11/3) prior to 4 pm or WA will be issued. JA will advise Atty. Olson's Office.  DE did not report to JSC by 11/3 at 4:00, Warrant issued. bph
Filed by ADA Becker. arc    e: Atty Olson.
Adjoining States- Signed by EFV on 10/18/22. c: SCSO. bph

1:50 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Aaron Damrau in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court. Defendant Nicole Marie Pilrain not in court. Court reviews case. ADA Damrau states DE has not been compliant with JSC. JSC states DE contacted JSC today and advised DE INIT for today. Court issues warrant- body only- Adjoining states. Adjourned 01:51 PM
DE stated she was in a car accident over the weekend and isn't able to make it to court today. JA advised DE will need to submit a request in writing for the judge to review.  gll
Filed by DA office Pam B. arc

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least 4 times per day between 6 AM and 10 PM (random). Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, D.A, H.A, and A.A..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:45 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Stephanie Schmidt in court. Defendant Nicole Marie Pilrain in court, in custody. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Unknown if DE qualifies for PD. Bond arguments. Court orders bond. Court sets STC. Adjourned 01:56 PM
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
